page.title: 09MRS. GASKELL
page.content: Elizabeth Gaskell first came to Knutsford in November 1811 when she was a year old. Her name was Elizabeth Cleghorn Stevenson until she married and became Mrs. Gaskell. Elizabeth was married in 1832 at Knutsford Parish Church. She had four children, all girls, but it was after the death of baby son, William, that she started writing books. These included 'Mary Barton', 'Cranford','North and South' and 'Wives and Daughters'. Cranford was based on her experiences of Knutsford. The house where she lived, Heathside, overlooks Little Heath. Elizabeth died at 55 and was buried in the churchyard of Brook Street Chapel.
